column1: #Text=The dive site Wondergat is an inland fresh water sinkhole and cavern near Mafikeng in the North West Province of South Africa .
#Text=This site is not in a Marine Protected Area .
#Text=The name " Wondergat " is Afrikaans for Amazing hole .
#Text=Visibility of over 30m has been known in the cave .
#Text=Wondergat is a collapsed cavern filled with water .
#Text=The hole is about 75 x 100m at the surface and the sides are near vertical to the bottom at about 36m .
#Text=There are caverns extending from the main shaft to the north and south at the bottom .
#Text=The bottom of these caverns slopes downward away from the main shaft .
#Text=There is an overhang to the north about half wat up , and a narrow cave on the south wall , quite shallow , known as Leopards cave .
#Text=Temperatures vary from 35âC in the summer to as low as -4âC at night in the winter .
#Text=Visibility is often better during winter because there are fewer divers kicking up a mess , and less rain runoff bringing in silt
#Text=Two permanent shotlines with grids at the bottom
#Text=Large capacity Air ( to 300 bar ) and Nitrox filling station on site .
#Text=Trimix is available on request and by prior arrangement .
#Text=Accommodation at Wondergat is at campsites with braai areas , and includes ablution facilities with hot and cold water .
#Text=There is a canteen , which stocks most of the basics for those who have forgotten something at home .
#Text=Take-away meals can be arranged in advance .
#Text=Emergency oxygen provision is on site if needed
#Text=All South African cellular networks cover the dive site
#Text=The nearest medical facility is the hospital at Mafikeng , 30km away and Lightenburg Provincial hospital , 60km away .
#Text=The walk down the steps fully kitted up requires good balance , and the return after the dive can be strenuous .
#Text=Adequate parking is provided and included in the entry fee .
#Text=From Johannesburg and other places to the south and east :
#Text=From Pretoria and other places to the north and west :
#Text=Wondergat may occasionally be closed to visitors for maintenance .
#Text=Phone before planning the trip to ensure it will be open when you wish to visit .
#Text=The Banded Tilapia ( Tilapia sparrmanii ) is endemic to Wondergat .
#Text=Other fish include the Sharptooth Catfish ( Clarias garipinus ) , Southern Moutbrooder ( Pseudocrenilabrus philander )
#Text=There are also fresh water shrimps and crabs .
#Text=The memorial stones and task force noticeboard at the mouth to the south cavern
#Text=1. Cavern certified divers can dive from the south grid to the back of the cave
#Text=From the north grid to south grid or vice versa along the guide ropes .
#Text=3. From either of the grids to the Bell .
#Text=From the south grid to the Memorial stones and the Taskforce noticeboard .
#Text=Dry suits or semi dry suits are recommend for the winter months .
